==Definition==
 
==Definition==
−
A basic definition of wisdom is the judicious application of [[knowledge]].<ref>"Wisdom is the right use of knowledge." – [[Charles Haddon Spurgeon]] (1834–1892)</ref> The opposite of wisdom is [[Foolishness|folly]]. Synonyms include prudence, sagacity, discernment, or insight.
+
A basic definition of wisdom is the judicious application of [[knowledge]].<ref>"Wisdom is the right use of knowledge." – [[Charles Haddon Spurgeon]] (1834–1892)</ref> The opposite of wisdom is [[Foolishness|folly]]. Synonyms include [[prudence]], [[sagacity]], [[discernment]], or insight.
